intro: Hieracium pilosella subsp. kiebleri, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has hairy stems and leaves, with small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its subspecies status highlights subtle morphological differences from other Hieracium species.
